questions.question: 1. What is the typical shape of the output characteristic curve for an n-channel JFET?
2. In the ohmic region of an n-channel JFET, the device behaves like a:
3. What happens to the drain current (I_D) when the gate-source voltage (V_GS) is made more negative?
4. What is the pinch-off voltage (V_P) in an n-channel JFET?

answers.a: The voltage at which the channel is fully open
answers.b: The voltage at which the channel is fully closed
answers.c: The voltage at which the drain current starts to decrease
answers.d: The voltage at which the gate-source junction becomes forward biased

questions.question: 5. In which region of an n-channel JFET is the drain current (I_D) relatively independent of the drain-source voltage (V_DS)?
6. What is the primary factor controlling the drain current (I_D) in the saturation region of an n-channel JFET?
7. How does the transconductance (g_m) of an n-channel JFET vary with the gate-source voltage (V_GS)?
8. What is the relationship between the drain current (I_D) and the gate-source voltage (V_GS) in the saturation region for an n-channel JFET?

answers.a: I_D is directly proportional to V_GS
answers.b: I_D is inversely proportional to V_GS
answers.c: I_D is proportional to the square of (V_GS - V_P)
answers.d: I_D is proportional to the exponential of V_GS

questions.question: 9. What is the effect of temperature on the output characteristics of an n-channel JFET?
10. In an n-channel JFET, when the gate-source voltage (V_GS) is zero, the device operates in which region?
